workflow.name: IMPLEMENTATION
workflow.overview: Executed after a plan is approved in the Planning workflow. The orchestrator launches a Swarm Manager to coordinate implementation agents. The orchestrator does NOT manage individual agents — the swarm manager handles dispatch, monitoring, and escalation.

phase.name: LAUNCH
phase.actor: Orchestrator launches a Swarm Manager agent (reasoning tier)

actions.action: Pass the approved plan, ticket ID, and ticket issue_type to the swarm manager

The swarm manager creates the feature branch before dispatching any agents. Branch naming: look up the ticket's issue_type in docs/.starter_pack_docs/workflows/BEADS.xml issue-types to find the corresponding branch-prefix. Example: issue_type "feature" → branch-prefix "FEAT/" → git checkout -b FEAT/sp-0004 See docs/.starter_pack_docs/workflows/BEADS.xml for the full issue_type to branch prefix mapping.

phase.status-message: executing IMPLEMENTATION/LAUNCH on {ticket-id} with swarm manager

actions.action: Read the plan's sub-task list and dependency ordering

For each sub-task, determine the model tier using the planner's complexity rating (see docs/.starter_pack_docs/workflows/MODELS.xml dispatch-override section): - light complexity → haiku (light tier) - standard complexity → sonnet (worker tier) - complex complexity → opus (reasoning tier)
Launch dependent sub-tasks sequentially after their dependencies complete

Each implementation agent receives: - The sub-task description, files to modify, acceptance criteria - The branch to commit to - The ticket ID for commit messages - The full escalation protocol from docs/.starter_pack_docs/workflows/MODELS.xml escalation-rules/implementation-agents
Collect results from each implementation agent as they complete
Track: success/failure, files modified, commits made
For failed agents, collect the structured failure report: - What was attempted - The error encountered - Files involved - What was committed (if partial work was saved)

phase.name: EVALUATE
phase.on-success: All agents succeeded → proceed to REPORT

on-failure.action: Launch an Escalation Agent (reasoning tier) with the failure context
If escalation agent resolves the issue → re-dispatch remaining work (loop to DISPATCH)
If escalation agent also fails → escalate to orchestrator for human input

phase.name: REPORT
phase.actor: Swarm Manager reports back to Orchestrator

report-contents.item: Any warnings or concerns noted during implementation

phase.name: HUMAN_GATE

presents.item: Any concerns raised by the swarm manager

phase.gate: BLOCKED — Do not proceed. Human approval required before continuing.
phase.on-rejection: Orchestrator passes feedback to swarm manager → loop to DISPATCH
phase.status-message: awaiting IMPLEMENTATION/HUMAN_GATE on {ticket-id} — BLOCKED: human approval required

phase.name: HANDOFF
phase.description: Once approved, proceed to the DOCS workflow.
phase.status-message: executing IMPLEMENTATION/HANDOFF on {ticket-id} — transitioning to DOCS

section.name: commit-discipline
section.rule: Every commit message starts with the ticket ID (discover prefix from beads, never guess)
Commits must be granular — one logical change per commit
Multiple commits per sub-task are expected
Each commit must be atomic and independently valid (builds, no broken imports)
Never commit secrets, .env files, or credentials

section.name: escalation-protocol
section.rule: If you encounter an error, retry once with a different approach
If the retry fails, stop immediately
Commit any partial work that is valid

What happens next (you do not need to handle this — just report and stop): → The swarm manager launches an Escalation Agent (reasoning tier) with your failure context → If the escalation agent resolves the issue, remaining work is re-dispatched → If the escalation agent also fails, it goes to the orchestrator → human for guidance

section.name: scope
section.rule: Only modify files specified in the sub-task
If changes to out-of-scope files are needed, stop and report back
Do not refactor, improve, or clean up code outside the sub-task scope
